docblock.description: This file is part of the Aura project for PHP.
The CLI equivalent of a page-controller to perform a single action.
A Getopt object for the Command; retains the short and long options passed at the command line.
The option definitions for the Getopt object.
Should Getopt be strict about how options are processed? In strict mode, passing an undefined option will throw an exception; in non-strict, it will not.
The positional (numeric) arguments passed at the command line.
Constructor.
Passes the Context arguments to `$getopt`.
Loads `$params` from `$getopt`.
Executes the Command.
Runs at the beginning of `exec()` before `preAction()`.
Runs before `action()` but after `preExec()`.
The main logic for the Command.
Runs after `action()` but before `postExec()`.
Runs at the end of `exec()` after `postAction()`.
This file is part of the Aura project for PHP.
Collection point for information about the command-line execution context.
Values taken from $_SERVER['argv'].
Imported $_ENV values.
Imported $_SERVER values.
Constructor.
Retrieves an **unfiltered** value by key from the $env property, or an alternate default value if that key does not exist.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The $env key to retrieve the value of.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value to return if the key does not exist.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The value of $env[$key], or the alternate default value.

docblock.description: Retrieves an **unfiltered** value by key from the $server property, or an alternate default value if that key does not exist.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The $server key to retrieve the value of.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value to return if the key does not exist.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The value of $server[$key], or the alternate default value.

docblock.description: Retrieves an **unfiltered** value by position from the `$argv` property, or an alternate default value if that position does not exist.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The `$argv` positional key to retrieve the value of.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value to return if the key does not exist.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The value of $server[$key], or the alternate default value.

docblock.description: Shifts the first value off the `$argv` property and returns it.
docblock.long-description: Note that this modifies the $argv property; if you need the original, unmodified arguments, call server('argv').

tag.name: return
tag.description: The value shifted off the beginning of the `$argv` property.

docblock.description: Sets the `$argv` property.
Common method to get a property value and return it.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The property variable to fetch from: get, post, etc.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The array key in that property, if any, to get the value of.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The alternative default value to return if the requested key does not exist.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The requested value, or the alternative default value.

docblock.description: This file is part of the Aura project for PHP.

Retrieves and validates command-line options and parameter values.
If an option is passed that is not defined, throw an exception.
Do not throw exceptions when undefined options are passed.
A factory to create Option objects.
Definitions for recognized options.
Remaining non-option params after loading option values.
The incoming arguments, typically from $_SERVER['argv'].
Constructor.
Make Option values available as magic readonly properties.
Initializes the instance with option definitions.

tag.description: An array of key-value pairs where the key is the option name and the value is the option spec.

tag.description: Initialize in strict (true) or non-strict (false) mode?

docblock.description: Returns all the Option definition objects.
Returns a single Option definition object by its property name.

tag.description: The property name of the option.

docblock.description: Returns an array of all Option names and their values.
Returns the value of a single Option by name.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The option name to get a value for.

docblock.description: Returns an array of all numeric parameters.
Returns a single Option definition object by its long-format name.

docblock.description: Returns a single Option definition object by its short-format name.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The long-format name of the option.

docblock.description: Loads Option values from an argument array, placing option values in the defined Option objects and placing non-option params in a `$params` variable.
Parses a long-form option.
Parses a short-form option (or cluster of options).
Parses a cluster of short options.
This file is part of the Aura project for PHP.
Defines a single command-line option.
A parameter value is required to be present for this option.
Any parameter value on this option will be rejected.
A parameter value may or may not be present on this option.
The property name of the option.
The long name of the option.
The short name of the option.
When the option is present, will a be parameter required, optional, or rejected (i.e., no param allowed) ?
Can the option be specified multiple times?
The default value for the option param.
The option value as set from the command line.

tag.description: The short form of the option flag.

tag.description: Whether a param is required, optional, or rejected.

tag.description: Can the option be specified multiple times?

tag.name: param
tag.description: The default value of the option param.

Gets the option value.

tag.description: The value as set from the command line, or the default value if not set from the command line.

docblock.description: Gets the long name for this option.
Gets the short name for this option.
Gets the property name for this option.
Gets the default value of this option.
Can this option be present multiple times?
Is a param value required to be present on this option?
Is a param value required *not* to be present on this option?
Is a param value optional on this option?
This file is part of the Aura project for PHP.
A factory to create Option objects.

property.name: $params
property.default: array('name' => null, 'long' => null, 'short' => null, 'param' => null, 'multi' => null, 'default' => null)

docblock.description: An array of default parameters for Option objects.
Creates and returns a new Option object.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of key-value pairs corresponding to Option constructor params.

docblock.description: This file is part of the Aura project for PHP.
Provides a wrapper for standard input/output handles.
A handle for standard input.
A handle for standard output.
A handle for standard error.
A Vt100 object to format output.
Constructor.
Returns the standard input handle.
Returns the standard output handle.
Returns the standard error handle.
Gets user input from the command line and trims the end-of-line.
Gets user input from the command line and leaves the end-of-line in place.
Prints text to standard output via the Vt100 formatter **without** a trailing newline.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The text to print to standard output.

docblock.description: Prints text to standard output via the Vt100 formatter **with** a trailing newline.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The text to print to standard output.

docblock.description: Prints text to standard error via the Vt100 formatter **without** a trailing newline.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The text to print to standard error.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The text to print to standard error.

docblock.description: This file is part of the Aura project for PHP.
Text formatting for VT100 terminals.
Array of format conversions for use on a variety of pre-set console style combinations.
docblock.long-description: Based on ANSI VT100 Color/Style Codes according to the VT100 User Guide and the ANSI/VT100 Terminal Control reference. Inspired by PEAR Console_Color.

docblock.description: The POSIX terminal flag.
The PHP_OS value.
docblock.long-description: Provided so we can fake the OS as needed.

docblock.description: Forces output to format for POSIX terminals, or to strip for non-POSIX terminals; when null, will auto-determine if the terminal is POSIX.

tag.name: param
tag.description: True to force formatting, false to force stripping, or null to auto-determine.

docblock.description: Gets the value of the POSIX terminal flag.
Sets the `$php_os` value.
Gets the `$php_os` value.
Converts VT100 %-markup in text to control codes.
Strips VT100 %-markup from text.
Writes text to a file handle, converting to control codes if the handle is a posix TTY, or to plain text if not.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The text to write to the file handle, converting %-markup if the handle is a posix TTY, or stripping markup if not.

docblock.description: Writes text to a file handle, converting to control codes if the handle is a posix TTY, or to plain text if not, and then appends a newline.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The text to write to the file handle, converting %-markup if the handle is a posix TTY, or stripping markup if not.

docblock.description: Determines if a stream handle should be treated as a POSIX terminal.
